ANHYDROUS AMMONIA SALES CONTRACT

Contract No.: TRAMMO-LT-2026-0003
Date: December 1, 2025
Effective: January 1, 2026

BETWEEN:
Trammo SAS ("Seller")
AND:
BASF SE ("Buyer")

LONG TERM CFR AMMONIA SALES AGREEMENT

1. PRODUCT AND SPECIFICATIONS

Product: Anhydrous Ammonia (NH3)
Specifications: Purity minimum 99.8%, water maximum 0.15%, oil maximum 3 ppm.
Temperature at loading: minus 33 degrees Celsius.

2. QUANTITY

Annual Quantity: 120,000 metric tons per year +/- 10% more or less at
buyer's option. Individual shipment size: approximately 20,000 metric tons
per shipment.

Shipping tolerance: Each shipment shall be 20,000 metric tons +/- 5%.

3. INCOTERMS

INCOTERMS 2020: CFR Ludwigshafen, Germany (via Rhine barge ex seagoing vessel).

4. SHIPMENTS AND NOMINATIONS

Shipments / nominations: Buyer shall nominate quantities quarterly. Within each
quarter, nominations shall be spread as evenly as practicable across the months.
Nominations and Notices: Buyer shall provide nomination for each quarter no later
than 45 days prior to the start of the quarter. Individual vessel nominations
require 20 days prior notice.

5. PRICE

The price for the first calendar year shall be the average of the Fertecon and
FMB (Fertilizer Market Bulletin) Northwest Europe ammonia price assessments for
the month preceding delivery. Price will be agreed for subsequent years based on
the same index methodology.

EU duty adjustment formula: CFR price divided by 0.9419 for non-duty-free origins.

6. PAYMENT

Payment: By irrevocable letter of credit, payable at sight, or by telegraphic
transfer within 30 days from bill of lading date if creditworthy counterparty.

7. LAYTIME AND DEMURRAGE

Discharge Rate and Demurrage: Discharge rate 600 mt per hour. Laytime calculated
as B/L quantity divided by discharge rate. Demurrage $32,000 per day or pro rata.
Claims within 90 calendar days from completion of discharge.

8. CHARTER PARTY

ASBATANKVOY Charter Party form is incorporated by reference herein. Seller is
deemed as "owner" and Buyer as "charterer."

9. LETTER OF INDEMNITY

LOI: Seller may deliver cargo without presentation of an original Bill of Lading
upon issuance of a Letter of Indemnity in P&I Club standard form.

10. TAXES, FEES AND DUES

Taxes, Fees and Dues: Import duties, VAT, and all taxes at destination shall be
added to the sale price. Export taxes at origin are for Seller's account.
Buyer is responsible for all import duty responsibility and customs clearance.

11. COMPLIANCE WITH EXPORT AND IMPORT LAWS

Compliance with Import Laws: Import of ammonia into Germany is not prohibited.
REACH registration maintained (EC No. 231-635-3). Safety Data Sheet provided
annually or upon request.

12. WAR RISK

War Risk: Costs arising from transit through Joint War Committee listed areas
shall be for Buyer's account. In the event of Main Shipping Routes Closure
affecting the agreed route, either party may request alternate routing or
suspension of deliveries.

13. FORCE MAJEURE

Force Majeure: Neither party shall be liable for failure to perform due to
Force Majeure events beyond reasonable control. The affected party must notify
the other within 7 days notice. If Force Majeure continues for more than 90
days, either party may cancel the affected shipments.

14. DEFAULT AND REMEDIES

Event of Default: Material breach not remedied within 48 hours of notice
entitles termination of the entire agreement. Interest on overdue payments
at 2% per annum above EURIBOR. Right of setoff and netting under this and
all related agreements is fully preserved.

15. EXCLUSION OF WARRANTIES

Disclaimer of Warranties: SELLER MAKES NO WARRANTY, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED,
INCLUDING WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY OR FITNESS FOR PURPOSE.

16. CLAIMS

Claims: Written notice of any claim within 15 days of discharge completion.
Claims absolutely barred unless arbitration commenced within one year.

17. GOVERNING LAW AND ARBITRATION

Governing Law: English law shall apply.
Arbitration: All disputes under LMAA terms in London.

18. NOTICES

Notices: All notices deemed to be given when delivered by courier, fax,
or e-mail to registered addresses.

19. MISCELLANEOUS

Miscellaneous: This constitutes the Entire Agreement. Modifications in
writing only. Waiver of one breach not a continuing waiver. Assignment
with prior written consent. Severability of invalid provisions.

20. HARDSHIP

Hardship: If the fundamental equilibrium of this contract is substantially
altered due to unforeseen circumstances, either party may request renegotiation
in good faith.

21. REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES

Representations and Warranties: Each party represents that it has full
corporate power and authority to enter into this agreement and perform its
obligations hereunder.
